item.description:
Lecture: The Construction and Architecture of the Carpenter Memorial Library
Tuesday, June 11, 2013
7:00 p.m.
Free admission
In the auditorium of the Manchester City Library - 405 Pine Street

Join us as we continue to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the Carpenter Memorial Library, the Manchester City Library's main building. This beautiful classical Italianate building is one of Manchester's most distinctive landmarks. On June 11, 1913, the construction of the Carpenter Memorial library building began with the laying of the cornerstone and the setting of mortar by donor Frank P. Carpenter. Jennifer Yakunovich, Museum Educator for the Manchester Historic Association will present an illustrated talk about the construction and architecture of the building. After the talk, participants will be invited to join a guided tour of the building's interior.

ï»¿
item.how_to_find_us: The auditorium is in the basement of the library building.
item.name: Lecture: The Construction and Architecture of the Carpenter Memorial Library
